title: 103_hr3484
content: The Act titled "National Environmental Policy Act Administrative Reorganization Amendments of 1993" establishes the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 establishes the Office of NEPA Compliance within the Executive Office of the President. The Director of the Office is appointed by the President with Senate approval and is responsible for promulgating regulations for federal agencies to implement the Act. The Office of NEPA Compliance oversees the implementation of the National Environmental Policy Act, including mediating interagency disputes and monitoring federal agency compliance with the Act and its regulations. The Office of NEPA Compliance oversees the implementation of the National Environmental Policy Act, including developing alternative procedures for compliance in emergency circumstances or when new information requires supplementing existing analysis. They also provide guidance to federal agencies on implementing the Act and its regulations. The National Environmental Policy Act Administrative Reorganization Amendments of 1993 specify the functions of the Director related to environmental laws and policies. The Act does not affect the independence of independent regulatory commissions. The Director is responsible for reviewing and appraising federal government programs in line with the Act's policy. The Director is tasked with reviewing federal government programs to determine their contribution to environmental policy goals and make recommendations to the President. This includes coordinating the development of national policies to improve environmental quality and providing studies and recommendations as requested by the President. The Director assists federal agencies in evaluating the effectiveness of government programs and projects that impact environmental quality. The President has the authority to transfer the Director's functions to other officials within the Executive Office of the President or federal agencies. The Director's functions can be transferred by the President to other officials. The Director must keep Congress informed of the Office's actions. Referrals of interagency disagreements on major federal actions affecting the environment should be mediated by the Office. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is amended by redesignating certain sections and replacing "Council" with "Office". The Environmental Quality Improvement Act of 1970 is also amended. The Environmental Quality Improvement Act of 1970 is amended by redesignating sections, changing fund names, and adding definitions. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is amended to allow the Director to utilize personnel from other entities to assist in the functions of the Office. Authorization of appropriations is also included. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is amended to authorize appropriations for the Director, with specific amounts allocated for fiscal years 1994 to 1997. Amounts appropriated to the Office or Director remain available until expended. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is amended to define key terms such as Director, Fund, and Office. SEC. 8. TRANSFER OF FUNCTIONS TO SECRETARY OF THE ENVIRONMENT. Transfers of functions from the Council on Environmental Quality and the Chairman to the Secretary of the Environment are outlined in this section, ensuring that these transfers do not impact other laws. The Secretary of the Environment is accountable to Congress for all functions outlined in the section, with authorization for necessary appropriations to carry out these functions effectively. SEC. 9. TERMINATION OF COUNCIL ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. Termination of the Council on Environmental Quality and the Office of Environmental Quality, along with references to them in federal laws and documents, are deemed to refer to the Director of the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance Office. The Director of the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance is responsible for disputes and matters described in specific sections of the Act. All previous administrative actions issued by the President, Council on Environmental Quality, or the Office of Environmental Quality are continued. The Director of the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance is responsible for disputes and matters described in specific sections of the Act. Previous administrative actions issued by the President, Council on Environmental Quality, or the Office of Environmental Quality will continue in effect until modified, terminated, or revoked in accordance with the law. The provisions of this Act do not affect pending proceedings before the Council on Environmental Quality. Orders issued in these proceedings will continue until modified or revoked by an authorized official, court, or operation of law. The Act does not affect ongoing proceedings before the Council on Environmental Quality. Any suits involving the Council or Office of Environmental Quality will continue as if the Act had not been enacted. The enactment of this Act does not affect ongoing proceedings before the Council on Environmental Quality. Administrative actions related to regulations by the Council will be continued by the Director of the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance or the President. Contracts, liabilities, records, and assets of the Council and Office of Environmental Quality will now be considered assets of the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance. The Director of the Office of National Environmental Policy Act Compliance will have access to amounts available to the Council on Environmental Quality before the enactment of this Act. SEC. 10. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is amended to make various changes, including replacing "Council on Environmental Quality" with "Director" and removing certain sections. The National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 is amended to replace "the Citizen's" with "the Office's" in section 205(1) and "the Council's" with "the Office's" in section 205(2). HR 3484 IH----2
